## This room will be closed and archived.
** @/all Please move discussion of this topic to our forum, or to one of the official Free Code Camp chat rooms: http://forum.freecodecamp.com/t/free-code-camp-official-chat-rooms/19390**

-----

hi anyone know in android java??

Have been to one free code camp meeting last year at 804RVA. Lost my login and I'm restarting all over again. Repetition is good, right? Been coding for years, firstly in Ohio Scientific Superboard 2 basic at home then cobol as a programmer. Also worked with Quickbasic, QBasic, C, Turbo Pascal, RPG2, C# 1.0 to 10, Java for Android. Currently Data Engineer for Marketing company. Mainly SQL Server and ETL  development.

##Please note that we now recommend campers use their Campsite’s Facebook group for chatting instead of their campsite’s Gitter chatroom. 
We are doing this because few of our Campsite Gitter chatroooms have active synchronous discussions, and about 1/3rd of conversations consist of someone saying “hello” and not getting a response. Most of the discussions are asynchronous, which Facebook posts and group messages are better suited for.
We’ve removed this Gitter room from our Campsite directory. Still, we will keep it open for archival purposes, and you can keep using it if you’d like.
Here’s a short blog post about how our Campsites are evolving and growing: http://blog.freecodecamp.com/2015/09/jump-start-your-local-campsite-with-coffee-and-code.html

If there's anyone in the Roanoke/Christiansburg/Floyd area, I'm creating a local campsite specifically for Floyd. We have a Facebook page set up: https://www.facebook.com/groups/free.code.camp.floyd.virginia/
@tonyerskine I'm really close to Lynchburg actually, maybe 2-hours away. Unfortunately my mode of transportation recently hit the dust so I won't be able to attend any Lynchburg-local meets.
@crowesam I haven't tried using their screen share app yet. If we meet up again let's see if we can get it working. :)
I'm glad I came and it was good to learn at 804rva and be with everyone else!

So bummed I could not get there. I've completed everything up to the first several bonfires that are recommended for team coding. I've had  trouble with their recommended screen share app and would like to do some live team coding.
It was awesome seeing everyone tonight! I'm usually on chat when I'm working through the problems so if anyone wants some help or someone to talk to, I'll be here. ^_^
Hello World!!

@tonyerskine I'd be interested in a nearby campsite. As for advice, I'm not sure how they generally work. I suppose it depends on where everyone is at on FCC. I imagine it would be especially useful for people in the BaseJump phase of FCC program, as that's where (I think) the web-apps become complex and use full MEAN stack.

Also, sorry for the delayed response. I have my notifications in Lurk Mode, and I mainly check the main page and the HelpZiplines page
@tonyerskine  I'm interested in your apprenticeships. Too bad I live in Richmond but I'm still going to check this out. :)

@Sparklepaws @seanr707 I think we might be in the same area.  I'm in Lynchburg we do a lot of apprenticeships (www.sharptop.co/apprenticeships/) and are thinking about starting a Lynchburg camp site.  Would you guys or any one else be interested in learning programming near Lynchburg?
Hi, I'm just checking out FreeCodeCamp.  It looks awesome, I'm thinking about creating a campsite in Lynchburg.  Does anyone have any advice on how to do that?
@Sparklepaws gotta love the classics :)
Time to get classic: Hello world! Aspiring programmer here with a little background in the field, based near Roanoke VA. Looking forward to being here!
Just found this, looking forward to it!
Hello everyone! I signed up for the event at 804RVA. Looking forward to coding together. :)
@all I set up an event at 804RVA on September 9th for us to code together in person. Hope you can make it! http://www.meetup.com/804RVA/events/224647575/
Why am I not surprised Richmond has it's own room?  Biggest small city there is.  Glad to be here mates.
I mean, not me.
I see...sorry, no.
Roanoke, Lynchburg, Charlottesville, Farmville, etc.
@seanr707 and thanks!
@seanr707 how outside of Richmond do you mean?
and welcome @SamGitsIt
Just curious, is anyone here from nearby but outside the Richmond area?
Hello World!  I just signed up with Free Code Camp last night and was excited when I found that there are others from Richmond here!
I'd be interested in meeting up as well!
@andreagoulet how do I get an office at 804RVA?
Hello everyone!
@nakessler nice! I think you’re a little bit further along than I am.
@andreagoulet I'd be up for meeting with FCC Richmond folks--thanks for introducing me to the program! I'm currently making my way through the algorithm scripting bonfires.
If anyone ever wanted to meet, I have an office at 804RVA and would be happy to host.
@thillaishakthi  Yes it is
Hello everyone!
Is this Richmond va ?
Hello, room! Looks like I'm the first one here. :)
